sen.j: 向日町駅（むこうまちえき）は、京都府向日市寺戸町久々相にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）東海道本線（JR京都線）の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Mukomachi Station, located in Kuguso, Terado-cho, Muko City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway station of the Tokaido Main Line (JR Kyoto Line) that is operated by West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

Mukomachi Station, located in Kuguso, Terado-cho, Muko City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway facility of the Tokaido Main Line (JR Kyoto Line), which is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

Mukomachi Station, located in Kuguso, Terado-cho, Muko City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway facility of the Tokaido Main Line (JR Kyoto Line), which is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

sen.j: また日本貨物鉄道（JR貨物）の貨物駅でもあるが、2006年から貨物列車の発着は無い。
sen.e: It is also a freight station of Japan Freight Railway Company but no freight trains have departed from or arrived at this station since 2006.
It is also a freight station of the Japan Freight Railway Company, but freight trains have neither departed from nor arrived at the station since 2006.
It is also a freight station of the Japan Freight Railway Company, but freight trains have neither departed from nor arrived at the station since 2006.

sen.j: ICOCA・Jスルー利用可能駅。
sen.e: ICOCA and J-Through are available at this station.
ICOCA and J-Through are available at this station.
ICOCA and J-Through cards can be used at this station.
sen.cmt: can be used としました。

sen.j: ICOCAの相互利用対象であるPiTaPa（スルッとKANSAI協議会）も利用可能。
sen.e: PiTaPa, which is mutually usable between ICOCA, is also available.
PiTaPa, which is mutually usable with ICOCA, is also available.
PiTaPa, which is mutually usable with ICOCA, can also be used.
sen.cmt: can be used としました。

sen.j: 実際にはごく一部であるが京都市南区 (京都市)に跨っている。
sen.e: In fact, a small portion of the premises of the station belongs to Minami Ward of Kyoto City.
In fact, a small portion of the premises of the station belongs to Minami Ward of Kyoto City.
In fact, a small portion of the premises of the station belongs to Minami Ward of Kyoto City.

sen.j: 阪急京都本線東向日駅とは約500mほどの距離がある（徒歩で約10分）。
sen.e: Higashi-muko Station of Hankyu Kyoto Line is located about 500m away from this station (about 10 minutes walk).
Higashi-muko Station, of the Hankyu Kyoto Line, is located approximately 500 meters from this station (about a ten-minute walk).
Higashi-muko Station, of the Hankyu Kyoto Line, is located approximately 500 meters from this station (about a ten-minute walk).

sen.j: 同じ向日市内にある阪急京都線の東向日駅（旧・東向日町駅）・西向日駅（旧・西向日町駅）は1972年10月の市制施行とともに現在の駅名に改称されたが、向日町駅は市制を施行しても改称されなかった。
sen.e: Although Higashi-muko Station (old Higashi-mukomachi Station) and Nishi-muko Station (old Nishi-mukomachi Station) of Hankyu Kyoto Line, both are located in Muko City also, were renamed to the current station names when old Mukomachi was upgraded to Muko City in October 1972, Mukomachi Station was not renamed despite of upgrading to city status.

Although Higashi-muko Station (the old Higashi-mukomachi Station) and Nishi-muko Station (the old Nishi-mukomachi Station) of Hankyu Kyoto Line, which are also located in Muko City, were given their current names when old Mukomachi was upgraded to Muko City in October 1972, Mukomachi Station was not renamed despite the upgrade to city status.

Although Higashi-muko Station (the old Higashi-mukomachi Station) and Nishi-muko Station (the old Nishi-mukomachi Station) of the Hankyu Kyoto Line, which are also located in Muko City, were given their current names when old Mukomachi was upgraded to Muko City in October 1972, Mukomachi Station was not renamed despite the upgrade to city status.
sen.cmt: "Hankyu Kyoto Line"→"the Hankyu Kyoto Line"に変更しました。

sen.j: 電報略号 (鉄道)は『ムコ』（武蔵小金井駅と同じ）。
sen.e: The abbreviated name for telegraph is "Muko" (same with that of Musashi-Koganei Station).
The abbreviated name for telegraph is "Muko" (the same as that of Musashi-Koganei Station).
The abbreviated name for telegraph is "Muko" (the same as that of Musashi-Koganei Station).

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Structure of the station
The station's structure
Station layout

sen.j: プラットホーム2面4線の地上駅であるが、外側ホームには柵があり、内側のみ乗降の取り扱いを行う（時間帯によっては、内側線でも快速の通過がある）。
sen.e: This station is a ground station that has 2 platforms for 4 tracks but only the inner platform is used for getting on and off of passengers since the outer platform is enclosed by fences (depending on the time zone, Rapid trains pass through the inner tracks also).

This station is a ground station that has two platforms for four tracks, but only the inner platform is used for passengers getting on and off, because the outer platform is enclosed by fences (depending on the time zone, rapid trains pass through on the inner tracks also).

This station is a ground station that has two platforms for four tracks, but only the inner platform is used for passengers getting on and off, because the outer platform is enclosed by fences (depending on the time zone, rapid trains pass through on the inner tracks also).

sen.j: 駅舎は線路西側にあり、ホームへは連絡地下道で結ばれている。
sen.e: The station building is situated on the west side of the track and is linked with platforms by underground passage.
The station building is situated on the west side of the track and is connected to platforms via an underground passage.
The station building is situated on the west side of the track and is connected to platforms via an underground passage.

The area around the station
Station surroundings

sen.j: 同駅の大阪駅寄りにはJR西日本の京都総合運転所（旧・向日町運転所）がある。
sen.e: Kyoto Integrated Operation Center (old Mukomachi Operation Center) is situated on the Osaka side of the station.
Kyoto Integrated Operation Center (the old Mukomachi Operation Center) is situated on the Osaka side of the station.
Kyoto Integrated Operation Center (the old Mukomachi Operation Center) is situated on the Osaka side of the station.

sen.j: 4系統：（洛西ニュータウン線 洛西口駅前・第二回生病院前・洛西高校前・西竹の里町経由）洛西バスターミナル行（竹の里小学校前止まりの便あり）

Route 65 (Oharano Route via Higashiyama, Ukyonosato, Haigata): Buses bound for Minamikasuga-cho

sen.j: 66系統：（大原野線 東山・右京の里・灰方経由）小塩（十輪寺前）・西国三十三番霊場 第二十番札所 善峯寺（しあわせ地蔵）行（冬季（1月6日～2月末日）は、小塩（十輪寺前）止め）
sen.e: Route 66 : (Oharano Route via Higashiyama ・ Ukyonosato ・ Haigata) Buses bound for Oshio (Jurin-ji-mae) ・ Yoshimine-dera (Shiawase Jizo), No.20 hudasho of Saigoku 33 Kannon Pilgrimage (in winter season(January 6～end of February), all buses run as far as Oshio (Jurin-ji-mae))

Route 66 (Oharano Route via Higashiyama ・ Ukyonosato ・ Haigata): Buses bound for Oshio (Jurin-ji-mae) ・ Yoshimine-dera (Shiawase Jizo); No. 20 hudasho of Saigoku 33 Kannon Pilgrimage (in winter season (January 6～end of February); all buses run as far as Oshio (Jurin-ji-mae)

Route 66 (Oharano Route via Higashiyama, Ukyonosato, Haigata): Buses bound for Oshio (Jurin-ji-mae (Jurin-ji Temple)), Yoshimine-dera (Yoshimine-dera Temple) (Shiawase Jizo (Happiness Buddha)); No. 20 hudasho (a temple where amulets are collected) of Saigoku 33 Kannon Pilgrimage (in winter season (January 6 - end of February); all buses run as far as Oshio (Jurin-ji-mae))
sen.cmt: 英語の補足が可能な箇所は追加しました。

sen.j: 利用状況
sen.e: Status of usage
Conditions of usage
Passenger use

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約11,575人である。 （京都府統計書より）
sen.e: Average number of passengers a day in 2006 was 11,575 (based on the statistics compiled by Kyoto Prefectural Government).
According to statistics compiled by the Kyoto Prefectural Government, the average number of passengers a day in 2006 was 11,575.
According to Kyoto Prefecture Statistics Report, the average number of passengers a day in fiscal year 2006 was 11,575.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1876年（明治9年）7月26日 開業。
sen.e: This station commenced operation in 1876.
This station became operational in 1876.
July 26, 1876: The station became operational.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 国鉄分割民営化により、JR西日本・JR貨物の駅となる。
sen.e: It became the station of JR West and Japan Freight Railway Company thanks to the division and privatization of Japan National Railways.
It became a station of JR West and the Japan Freight Railway Company due to the division and privatization of Japan National Railways.
April 1, 1987: The station became a station of JR West and the Japan Freight Railway Company due to the division and privatization of Japan National Railways.

sen.j: 2006年（平成18年）3月18日? 貨物列車の設定が無くなる。
sen.e: Freight service was abolished as of March 18 (?), 2006.
Freight service was abolished on March 18(?), 2006.
Around March 18, 2006: Freight service was abolished.
sen.cmt: ? →around としました。年表表記に統一

sen.j: 住友大阪セメント京都サービスステーションへの専用鉄道があり、本巣駅・近江長岡駅よりセメント輸送貨物列車が到着していた。
sen.e: There used to be the exclusive track connecting to Kyoto Service Station of Sumitomo Osaka Cement Co.,Ltd. and freight trains for cement transportation used to arrive at this station from Motosu Station ・ Omi-Nagaoka Station.

There used to be an exclusive track connecting to Kyoto Service Station of the Sumitomo Osaka Cement Co., Ltd., and freight trains for the transport of cement used to arrive from Motosu Station ・ Omi-Nagaoka Station.

There used to be an exclusive track connecting to Kyoto Service Station of the Sumitomo Osaka Cement Co., Ltd., and freight trains for the transport of cement used to arrive from Motosu Station and Omi-Nagaoka Station.
sen.cmt: ・ → and に変更しました。

sen.j: かつては、新日本石油・昭和シェル石油の油槽所が付近にあり、そこへも専用線が続いていた。
sen.e: There used to be tank yards of Nippon Oil Corporation and Showa Shell Sekiyu K.K. nearby and they were also connected with this station by the exclusive tracks.
There were also tank yards of the Nippon Oil Corporation and Showa Shell Sekiyu K.K. nearby, and they were connected to the station by the exclusive tracks.
There were also tank yards of the Nippon Oil Corporation and Showa Shell Sekiyu K.K. nearby, and they were connected to the station by the exclusive tracks.

sen.j: その他、陸上自衛隊桂駐屯地や麒麟麦酒京都工場（1999年に閉鎖）までの専用線もあった。
sen.e: In addition, there used to be the exclusive tracks extending to Camp Katsura of Ground Self-Defense Force and Kyoto Works of Kirin Brewery Company (close in 1999).
Additionally, there used to be the exclusive tracks extending to Camp Katsura of the Ground Self-Defence Force and the Kyoto Works of the Kirin Brewery Company (which closed in 1999).
Additionally, there used to be the exclusive tracks extending to Camp Katsura of the Ground Self-Defense Force and the Kyoto Works of the Kirin Brewery Company (which closed in 1999).
sen.cmt: スペルを修正しました。
